1) You are correct, host valence for BdbFrontier is locked at 1. The
ARFron=
tier allows any number of simultaneous connections to a host, but it
may no=
t be suitable to your needs for other reasons. 
If politeness is truely not=
 an issue, you can lower the enforced wait times
to zero, effectively crawl=
ing much faster. However that is as far as you can
take things with the Bdb=
Frontier.
 
2) Yep, this is a tricky little bugger. When using HostScope I'=
ve found that
the following settings restrict the crawl to just the hosts I=
 specify with
no offsite embedding:
additionalScopeFocus
- enabled: true
- =
if-match-return: false
- use-default-patterns: Custom
- regexp: .*
 
transi=
tiveFilter
- enabled: true
- max-speculative-hops: 0
- max-referral-hops: 0=

- max-embed-hops: 0
 
Those two filters are added to most scopes to ensure=
 that offsite embedded
documents can be fetched. Disabling them is (as you =
can see) a bit weird but
the above should work fine.
 
Alternatively you co=
uld move to the DecidingScope which gives you more
direct control over what=
 to rule in and out.
 
- Kris
